meanings.definition: To demolish or clear (a building, town, or forest) with a bulldozer.
meanings.sent1: The construction crew will bulldoze the old house tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The city council decided to bulldoze the abandoned factory.
meanings.sent3: The bulldozer decided to take a break after bulldozing the entire block.
meanings.sent4: She bulldozed through the obstacles in her path to success.
meanings.sent5: The storm seemed to bulldoze everything in its way with fierce winds.

meanings.definition: To force or coerce (someone) into doing something.
meanings.sent1: The bully tried to bulldoze the smaller kids into giving him their lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The manager didn't want to bulldoze the employees into working overtime.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to bulldoze his way into getting a discount at the store.
meanings.sent4: Her determination bulldozed any doubts she had about completing the marathon.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict rules seemed to bulldoze the students into following them without question.

meanings.definition: To move or clear (something) by or as if by using a bulldozer.
meanings.sent1: The workers will bulldoze the snow off the road to make it passable.
meanings.sent2: The gardener needed to bulldoze the fallen branches to clear the path.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to bulldoze the toy mouse under the couch.
meanings.sent4: His strong arguments bulldozed any opposition during the debate.
meanings.sent5: The determined athlete bulldozed through the finish line, winning the race.
